description:
go.talks: use OMIT build tag to exclude example programs from build

They will still work with "go run x.go".

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.talks
Wait, what is the difference between OMIT and ignore?

On 17 July 2013 10:02, <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> Wait, what is the difference between OMIT and ignore?


OMIT lines are dropped by the present tool :-)

LGTM then

But I don't want to see OMIT in other contexts. Let's keep using ignore
elsewhere.

For sure.


On 17 July 2013 10:04, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> LGTM then
>
> But I don't want to see OMIT in other contexts. Let's keep using ignore
> elsewhere.
>
>

This was just an easy solution specific to the present tool. In hindsight,
the present tool should probably use "ignore" rather than "OMIT", and maybe
we should do that.

-rob

On 17 July 2013 10:31, Rob Pike <r@golang.org> wrote:

> This was just an easy solution specific to the present tool. In hindsight,
> the present tool should probably use "ignore" rather than "OMIT", and maybe
> we should do that.


I don't want lines that just have the word "ignore" to be dropped. OMIT
works well because it never occurs in actual prose.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=4eb3066a866f&repo=talks ***

go.talks: use OMIT build tag to exclude example programs from build

They will still work with "go run x.go".

R=golang-dev, rsc, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/11337043

subject: code review 11337043: go.talks: use OMIT build tag to exclude example program...
